metadata.description:
The data set contains the observation data of meteorological elements from the Dashalong Station,,which is located along the upper reaches of the Heihe Hydro-meteorological Observation Network, and the data set covers data from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2017. The station is located in Shalong Beach area on the west side of Qilian County, Qinghai Province. The underlying surface is swamp meadow. The latitude and longitude of the observation point is 98.9406E, 38.8399N, and the altitude is 3739m. The air temperature and relative humidity sensors are erected 5 meters above the ground, facing North; the barometer is installed in the pick-proof box on the ground; the tipping bucket rain gauge is erected 10 meters above the ground; the wind speed and direction sensor is set 10 meters above the ground, facing North; the four-component radiometer is installed 6 meters above the ground, facing South; two infrared thermometers are installed 6 meters above the ground, facing South, and the probe orientation is vertical downward; the soil temperature probes are buried respectively at 0cm on the ground surface, 4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm and 160cm under the ground, they are located 2 meters from the meteorological tower in the South; the soil moisture sensors are buried 4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm and 160cm under the ground, 2 meters from the meteorological tower in the South; the soil heat flow boards (3 pieces) are buried 6cm under the ground, 2 meters from the meteorological tower in the South. 
Observed items include: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m, RH_5m) (unit: Celsius, percentage), air pressure (Press) (unit: hectopascal), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_10m) (unit: meter / sec), wind direction (WD_10m) (unit: degree), four-component radiation (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watt / square meter), surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit: Celsius) , soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watt / square meter), soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_80cm, Ts_120cm, Ts_160cm) (unit: Celsius), soil moisture (Ms_4cm , Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_80cm, Ms_120cm, Ms_160cm) (unit: volumetric water content, percentage).
Processing and quality control of observation data: (1) Ensure 144 data per day (every 10 minutes), if there is missing data, it is marked as -6999. (2) Eliminate moments with duplicate records; (3) Remove data that is significantly beyond physical meaning or beyond the measuring range of the instrument; (4) Data marked by red is debatable; (5) The formats of the date and time are uniform, and the date and time are in the same column. For example, the time is: 2017-9-10 10:30; (6) The naming rule is: AWS + site name.
For hydro-meteorological network or site information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018). For observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2017年1月1日至2017年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网上游大沙龙站气象要素观测数据。站点位于青海省祁连县西侧沙龙滩地区，下垫面是沼泽化高寒草甸。观测点的经纬度是98.9406E, 38.8399N，海拔3739m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在地面上的防撬箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速与风向传感器架设在10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分探头埋设在地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，并距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2017-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况下。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果的比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，当EC通量测量的潜热（LE）和显热（H）与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全时，这一任务变得更加困难。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这一温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观测比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散（E）、温度（T）和蒸散量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡度相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括离地5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用10 Hz采样频率的EC系统在离地4.5米处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔上25米高的平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获取的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于蒸散发的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水资源联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估算的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估算也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: The alpine region is important in riverine and watershed ecosystems as a contributor of freshwater, providing and stimulating specific habitats for biodiversity. In parallel, recent climate change, human activities, and other perturbations may disturb hydrological processes and eco-functions, creating the need for next-generation observational and modeling approaches to advance a predictive understanding of such processes in the alpine region. Water resources in the alpine region are headwaters that need to be regulated to sustain downstream ecosystems. However, perturbations induced by nature/climate change and human activities in recent years have significantly reformed hydrological processes and eco-functions. Accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes and their key impact factors has since become crucial.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. In comparison with the observations, using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data (especially in the alpine region), which have to be validated and calibrated. In summary, to fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research, an integrated, distributed and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. In alpine hydrology, in addition to consistent hydrometeorological data obtained from distributed meteorological stations, snow cover and frozen ground are two important indexes and driving forces that manipulate hydrological processes. The maximum snow water equivalent (SWE) before ablation determines the storage of snowmelt – a major source of freshwater in the alpine region, while freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs) and soil moisture within the active layer alter water infiltration and, consequently, surface runoff and groundwater. To promote alpine hydrology research, the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) was launched in 2015 by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) project of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP), involving 18 catchments around the world. The INARCH has since connected individual observatories into an international network and data-share platform to lead frontier research on alpine region hydrometeorology and snow observation. Another community-based observation network, the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) network, was initiated in the early 1990s to observe the response of the active layer and near-surface permafrost to climate change. The Heihe River Basin (HRB) is the second largest inland river basin in China and is known for its heterogeneous landscapes, diverse ecosystems, unique geographical characteristics and climate change over recent decades. As a major component of the ecohydrological processes in the arid/semi-arid HRB, the alpine hydrological processes, especially those related to snow cover and frozen ground in the upper reaches, have great impacts on runoff in the mountainous region, which then regulate agricultural development in the middle reaches and the ecosystems of the lower reaches.

In recent years, with climate warming, permafrost degradation has significantly affected runoff and the carbon cycle (Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018). Snow cover is widely distributed with unique characteristics in the study area. In the high-altitude mountainous region (elevation > 3800 m), influenced by the local microclimate and low temperature, snowfall could occur in any season. Temporary snow is the major snow cover type in the region at middle and low elevations because strong solar radiation and high air temperature lead to fast melting and sublimation of the snow. Drifting snow is also commonly observed in the region, which may lead to the redistribution of snowpack in high elevation regions (Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014).

Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in the Qilian mountain due to its high altitude and complex terrain. It is important to estimate the occurrence of blowing snow because it may cause redistributions of the snow cover and influence the sublimation of snow.

Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.

This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years.

The associated open-access datasets include high-quality hydrometeorological data with specific respect to snow and frozen ground observations at the sub-basin and basin scales, which aims to address a variety of scientific questions including but not limited to: (1) how to provide accurate and effective forcing data for alpine hydrological models, (2) how to integrate observation, simulation and the acquired datasets for informative understanding, and (3) how perturbations (climate change and human activities) alter fundamental processes.

Considering the characteristics of the study site, an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network has been established with seven automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and two superstations. At the basin scale, the observation aims to collect data for investigating the meteorological driving forces and for validation of the alpine hydrological models. At the sub-basin scale, small-scale observations and measurements focus on data such as precipitation, soil temperature and moisture, which are used to develop and improve hydrologic models, as well as to validate remote sensing products at medium to coarse resolutions (Jin et al., 2014). At the two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, remote sensing products can be further validated using fine-resolution data. In total, seven AMSs, as well as the frozen ground and snow superstations (also incorporating meteorological observations), were established in the study area during the intensive observation period (IOP: 2013 -2014) to obtain the spatially distributed meteorological variables. After the IOP, four typical AMSs were selected and retained for continuous observation, which is expected to provide long-term datasets. The observed meteorological variables include wind (speed and direction), air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Accumulation and depletion processes were measured automatically at the Yakou snow superstation. The observed components included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE, measured by GammaMONitor, GMON), albedo of the snow surface and blowing (drifting) snow flux (measured by FlowCapt). Soil temperature and moisture were measured within six layers at each AMS, while evapotranspiration (ET) was observed by eddy covariance (EC) at three AMSs located in permafrost, seasonally frozen ground and a transient zone to observe freeze-thaw (FT) processes. At the sub-basin scale, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture. At the A’rou frozen ground superstation, soil temperature and moisture profiles were intensively measured in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m (in a nested pattern with more layers in the topsoil) to obtain the soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). In addition, thermal conductivity and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil were also measured to observe the dynamic hydrothermal processes within.

Snow depth was measured by SR50A (Campbell, USA), which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor, Campbell, USA) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt (IAV, Switzerland) was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.

backgroundCn: 阿尔卑斯地区在河流和流域生态系统中具有重要意义，作为淡水的来源，提供并刺激特定栖息地的生物多样性。与此同时，近期气候变化、人类活动和其他扰动可能会干扰水文过程和生态功能，因此需要下一代观测和建模方法，以推进对阿尔卑斯地区这些过程的预测理解。阿尔卑斯地区的水资源是源头水，需要进行调节以维持下游生态系统。然而，近年来自然/气候变化和人类活动引发的扰动显著改变了水文过程和生态功能。因此，准确估计和预测水文过程及其关键影响因素变得至关重要。

不幸的是，由于高山地区观测数据的稀缺，主要是由于获取困难和技术障碍，阻碍了高山水文模型及相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的开发。与观测数据相比，结合数据同化的遥感数据可以改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据（尤其是在高山地区）存在各种不确定性来源，这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准。总之，为了填补知识空白并促进高山地区水文研究，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终改善对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。在高山水文学中，除了从分布式气象站获得的一致的水文气象数据外，雪盖和冻土是两个重要指标和驱动因素，影响水文过程。融化前的最大雪水当量（SWE）决定了雪融水的储存——这是高山地区淡水的主要来源，而冻融循环（FTC）和活层内的土壤水分则改变了水的渗透，进而影响地表径流和地下水。为了促进高山水文研究，国际高山研究流域水文网络（INARCH）于2015年由世界气候研究计划（WCRP）的全球能量与水交换（GEWEX）项目发起，涉及全球18个流域。自那时以来，INARCH将各个观测站连接成一个国际网络和数据共享平台，以引领高山地区水文气象和雪观测的前沿研究。另一个基于社区的观测网络，极圈活层监测（CALM）网络，始于1990年代初，旨在观察活层和近地表永久冻土对气候变化的响应。黑河流域（HRB）是中国第二大内陆河流域，以其异质的景观、多样的生态系统、独特的地理特征和近年来的气候变化而闻名。作为干旱/半干旱HRB生态水文过程的主要组成部分，高山水文过程，特别是与上游雪盖和冻土相关的过程，对山区的径流产生了重大影响，从而调节中游的农业发展和下游的生态系统。

近年来，随着气候变暖，永冻土的退化显著影响了径流和碳循环（Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018）。研究区域内雪盖广泛分布，具有独特的特征。在高海拔山区（海拔 > 3800 米），受当地微气候和低温的影响，任何季节都可能出现降雪。临时雪是该地区中低海拔地区的主要雪盖类型，因为强烈的太阳辐射和高气温导致雪的快速融化和升华。漂移雪在该地区也常见，这可能导致高海拔地区雪盖的重新分布（Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014）。
由于祁连山的高海拔和复杂地形，常常观察到吹雪（漂移雪）。估计吹雪的发生是重要的，因为它可能导致雪盖的重新分布，并影响雪的升华。
土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。
research objectiveCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从一个综合的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络中研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。
相关的开放获取数据集包括高质量的水文气象数据，特别是针对子流域和流域尺度的雪和冻土观测，旨在解决多种科学问题，包括但不限于：(1) 如何为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，(2) 如何整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以获得有意义的理解，以及 (3) 如何扰动（气候变化和人类活动）改变基本过程。
challengesCn: 然而，寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形等几项严峻挑战，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。
不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型及相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发。然而，上述建模工作面临着两个主要问题：1）强迫数据的可用性（只有中国气象局在HRB上游运营的两个气象站正常工作）；2）缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于参数化。
不幸的是，由于强风的影响，这项工作并不顺利。因此，目前无法获得可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据计算的雪密度数据。
methodsCn: 无间断的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从一个雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也从一个冻土观测超级站获得，以捕捉冻融过程。

考虑到研究地点的特征，建立了一个综合的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，包含七个自动气象站（AMS）和两个超级站。在流域尺度上，观测旨在收集数据，以研究气象驱动因素并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型。在子流域尺度上，小规模的观测和测量集中在降水、土壤温度和湿度等数据上，这些数据用于开发和改进水文模型，以及验证中等到粗分辨率的遥感产品（Jin et al., 2014）。在两个雪盖和冻土观测的超级站中，可以利用高分辨率数据进一步验证遥感产品。在密集观测期（IOP：2013-2014）期间，在研究区域建立了七个AMS以及冻土和雪超级站（也包含气象观测），以获取空间分布的气象变量。IOP结束后，选择并保留了四个典型的AMS进行持续观测，预计将提供长期数据集。观测的气象变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。积雪和融雪过程在雅口雪超级站自动测量，观测的组成部分包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE，由GammaMONitor测量）、雪面反照率和飘雪（漂移雪）通量（由FlowCapt测量）。在每个AMS内，土壤温度和湿度在六个层次上进行测量，而蒸散发（ET）则在位于永久冻土、季节性冻土和过渡区的三个AMS上通过涡度协方差（EC）进行观测，以观察冻融（FT）过程。在子流域尺度上，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。在A’rou冻土超级站，土壤温度和湿度剖面在十八个层次上进行密集测量，深度达到3.2米（采用嵌套模式，表层有更多层次），以获取冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态水热过程。

雪深是通过SR50A（美国Campbell公司）测量的，该设备通过发出超声波脉冲并监听从目标反射回来的回声来确定传感器与目标之间的距离。雪水当量（SWE）是通过GMON（CS725 GammaMONitor，Campbell，USA）从2014年1月1日到2017年12月31日以6小时的时间分辨率进行测量的。FlowCapt（IAV，瑞士）用于测量在3个高度（0-1米、1-2米和2-3米）每10分钟的吹雪颗粒数量。
datasetCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从综合、分布式和多尺度观测网络研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络，监测到了无间隙的气象和水文数据。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。还从冻土观测超级站获取了高分辨率的土壤物理数据集，以捕捉冻融过程。这些更新的数据集已向具有多学科背景（如冰冻圈科学、水文学和气象学）的科学家发布，预计将作为一个测试平台，为更广泛的社区提供准确的强迫数据，并验证和评估遥感产品和水文模型。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。该观测网络由七个标准水文气象站、一个雪超级站和一个冻土超级站组成，作为一个综合研究平台，旨在提供HRB上游水文气象过程的显著数据集（如水文气象、雪和冻土），预计将支持阿尔卑斯地区水文模型的开发和模拟以及遥感观测。
来自Yakou雪超级站的综合雪数据集自2013年夏季以来已更新。观察到的雪变量包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE）和吹雪（飘雪）。2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日的数据在图4中进行了总结，并附有降水、蒸散发、土壤温度和湿度的额外图表。数据集的可用时间为2012年12月5日至2017年12月31日，期间由于高海拔地区的电力损失和传感器故障，数据 intermittently 丢失。
在本文中，展示了一套来自于黑河上游集成的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络的阿尔卑斯水文数据集。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'integrated, distributed and multiscale observation network' mean in the context of alpine hydrology research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在高山水文学研究的背景下，“集成、分布和多尺度观测网络”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: An 'integrated, distributed and multiscale observation network' in alpine hydrology research refers to a comprehensive system of monitoring and data collection that involves multiple automatic meteorological stations and superstations to capture a wide range of hydrometeorological variables across different scales. This network is designed to provide detailed and spatially distributed data on meteorological, snow cover, and frozen ground conditions, which are essential for understanding and modeling hydrological processes in alpine regions.
Definition.AnswerCn: “集成的、分布式的多尺度观测网络”在阿尔卑斯水文研究中指的是一个综合的监测和数据收集系统，该系统涉及多个自动气象站和超级站，以捕捉不同尺度的广泛水文气象变量。该网络旨在提供关于气象、雪盖和冻土条件的详细和空间分布数据，这些数据对于理解和建模阿尔卑斯地区的水文过程至关重要。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are 'soil and canopy component temperatures' and how are they used in evapotranspiration estimation models?
Definition.QuestionCn: 什么是“土壤和冠层组分温度”，它们如何用于蒸散估算模型中？
Definition.AnswerEn: 'Soil and canopy component temperatures' refer to the distinct temperatures of the soil surface and the vegetation canopy, respectively. These temperatures are crucial in two-source energy balance (TSEB) models for estimating evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration. The separation of these components allows for more accurate modeling of energy exchange processes in heterogeneous landscapes, as it accounts for the different temperatures and resistances of soil and vegetation.
Definition.AnswerCn: “土壤和冠层组件温度”指的是土壤表面和植被冠层的不同温度。这些温度在两源能量平衡（TSEB）模型中对于估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发至关重要。分离这些组件可以更准确地模拟异质景观中的能量交换过程，因为它考虑了土壤和植被的不同温度和阻力。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of 'freeze-thaw cycles' in alpine hydrological processes?
Definition.QuestionCn: “冻融循环”在高山水文过程中的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: 'Freeze-thaw cycles' are important in alpine hydrological processes as they affect soil moisture and infiltration, which in turn influence surface runoff and groundwater dynamics. These cycles involve the freezing and thawing of the active layer in permafrost regions, altering the physical properties of the soil and impacting hydrological models and predictions. Understanding freeze-thaw cycles is crucial for evaluating the effects of climate change and human activities on alpine water resources.
Definition.AnswerCn: “冻融循环”在高山水文过程中非常重要，因为它们影响土壤湿度和入渗，从而影响地表径流和地下水动态。这些循环涉及到永久冻土地区活层的冻结和融化，改变土壤的物理特性，并影响水文模型和预测。理解冻融循环对于评估气候变化和人类活动对高山水资源的影响至关重要。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for hydrometeorological measurements in the alpine region compare to those used in the oasis region in terms of equipment and environmental challenges?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 阿尔卑斯地区的水文气象测量数据收集方法与绿洲地区相比，在设备和环境挑战方面有什么不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In the alpine region, data collection methods face challenges such as cold climate, high altitude, and complex topography. They utilize an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network with automatic meteorological stations and superstations for snow and frozen ground observations. In contrast, the oasis region uses a superstation with a boundary layer tower and ground-based measurements, including thermal infrared cameras and eddy covariance systems, to capture meteorological parameters and surface fluxes. The alpine region's challenges lead to difficulties in continuous data collection, whereas the oasis region focuses more on thermal and radiometric measurements.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区，数据收集方法面临寒冷气候、高海拔和复杂地形等挑战。他们利用一个集成的、分布式的、多尺度的观测网络，配备自动气象站和超级站，用于雪和冻土观测。相比之下，绿洲地区使用一个配备边界层塔的超级站和地面测量，包括热红外相机和涡度协方差系统，以捕捉气象参数和表面通量。阿尔卑斯地区的挑战导致连续数据收集困难，而绿洲地区则更侧重于热量和辐射测量。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How do the complexities of the earth system in alpine regions influence the methodologies used for remote sensing data validation and calibration?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 阿尔卑斯地区地球系统的复杂性如何影响遥感数据验证和校准的方法论？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: In alpine regions, complexities such as high altitudes, cold climates, and varied topographies introduce various uncertainties in remote sensing data. These challenges necessitate the integration of remote sensing with ground-based observation networks and experiments to improve hydrological process predictions. Such integration is crucial for developing accurate models and for providing reliable data for hydrological research.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在高山地区，高海拔、寒冷气候和多样化地形等复杂因素给遥感数据带来了各种不确定性。这些挑战需要将遥感技术与地面观测网络和实验相结合，以提高水文过程预测的准确性。这种整合对于开发准确的模型和提供可靠的水文研究数据至关重要。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What role do freeze-thaw cycles and soil moisture play in the design and implementation of data collection networks in alpine hydrology?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 冻融循环和土壤湿度在高山水文学数据收集网络的设计和实施中扮演着什么角色？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Freeze-thaw cycles and soil moisture are critical in alpine hydrology, influencing water infiltration, surface runoff, and groundwater dynamics. Data collection networks are designed to capture these processes through high-resolution soil physics datasets and observations from frozen ground superstations. These measurements help evaluate hydrological models and validate remote sensing products, addressing the unique hydrological challenges posed by alpine environments.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 冻融循环和土壤湿度在高山水文学中至关重要，影响水的渗透、地表径流和地下水动态。数据收集网络旨在通过高分辨率的土壤物理数据集和来自冻土超级观测站的观测来捕捉这些过程。这些测量有助于评估水文模型和验证遥感产品，解决高山环境所带来的独特水文挑战。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to challenges in collecting hydrometeorological data in alpine regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在高山地区收集水文气象数据面临的挑战因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Several formidable challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed, which hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 多个严峻的挑战，包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，妨碍了在需要时进行全面和一致的数据收集，这阻碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes uncertainties in estimating evapotranspiration using remote sensing in heterogeneous landscapes?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，使用遥感估算蒸散发的不确定性原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The uncertainties in remote sensing data are caused by the complexities of the earth system, particularly in the alpine region. Factors such as image classification errors, atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance, and estimation of incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy contribute to these uncertainties.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 遥感数据中的不确定性是由于地球系统的复杂性，特别是在高山地区。图像分类错误、大气上行辐射和透射、以及通过树冠估算的入射短波和长波辐射透射等因素都导致了这些不确定性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What consequences might arise from the scarcity of observation data in alpine regions on the development of hydrological models?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺可能对水文模型的发展产生哪些后果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data in alpine regions, due to access difficulties and technological barriers, hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and hydrological models. It results in limited availability of forcing data and high-quality snow and frozen ground data, which are essential for parameterization and accurate modeling in these regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺，由于访问困难和技术障碍，阻碍了遥感技术和水文模型的发展。这导致强迫数据和高质量雪和冻土数据的可用性有限，而这些数据对于参数化和在这些地区进行准确建模至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What impact does the establishment of an integrated, distributed observation network have on understanding hydrometeorological processes in alpine regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 建立一个综合的、分布式的观测网络对理解高山地区的水文气象过程有什么影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The establishment of an integrated, distributed observation network can significantly enhance the understanding of hydrometeorological processes in alpine regions by providing comprehensive datasets that capture meteorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data. This enables the investigation of watershed science and functions on multiple scales, supports the development of alpine hydrological models, and aids in validating remote sensing observations.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 建立一个综合的分布式观测网络可以显著增强对高山地区水文气象过程的理解，通过提供全面的数据集，捕捉气象、雪盖和冻土数据。这使得在多个尺度上研究流域科学和功能成为可能，支持高山水文模型的开发，并有助于验证遥感观测。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the motivations behind developing next-generation observational networks for alpine hydrology research?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 开发下一代观测网络以进行高山水文学研究的动机是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The motivation includes overcoming challenges posed by the scarcity of observation data due to difficult access and technological barriers in alpine regions. The goal is to advance a predictive understanding of hydrological processes by providing integrated, distributed, and multiscale datasets. These networks aim to improve the accuracy and reliability of hydrological models, validate remote sensing data, and enhance the understanding of ecosystem functions and the impacts of climate change and human activities.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 动机包括克服由于难以进入和技术障碍而导致的高山地区观测数据稀缺的挑战。目标是通过提供综合的、分布式的和多尺度的数据集，推进对水文过程的预测理解。这些网络旨在提高水文模型的准确性和可靠性，验证遥感数据，并增强对生态系统功能及气候变化和人类活动影响的理解。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methods are utilized to ensure the accuracy and consistency of hydrometeorological data collection in remote alpine regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在偏远高山地区，确保水文气象数据收集的准确性和一致性的方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data are monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). Furthermore, to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes, snow cover properties are collected from a snow observation superstation using advanced techniques and instruments. High-resolution soil physics datasets are also obtained to capture freeze-thaw processes from a frozen ground observation superstation.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 无缝的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进技术和仪器从雪观测超级站收集雪盖特性数据。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也从冻土观测超级站获取，以捕捉冻融过程。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the procedural steps undertaken to validate the accuracy of soil and canopy component temperatures derived from thermal images in the estimation of evapotranspiration?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 验证从热成像中获得的土壤和冠层温度准确性的程序步骤，以估算蒸散发的过程包括哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Field observations are obtained using a thermal infrared camera to measure soil and canopy component temperatures. These temperatures are used as inputs to a series of the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model. The soil and canopy component temperatures are calculated by classifying visible and NIR images into soil and canopy pixels, and extracting directional brightness temperatures from thermal images. These temperatures are then converted to radiometric temperatures using incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and emissivities. The simulated radiometric temperatures are validated against surface radiometric temperatures calculated from observations by a four-component radiometer.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 现场观测是通过热红外相机获得的，用于测量土壤和冠层组分的温度。这些温度作为输入用于一系列双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型。土壤和冠层组分的温度通过将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素，并从热图像中提取方向亮度温度来计算。这些温度随后通过来自天空的入射长波辐射和发射率转换为辐射温度。模拟的辐射温度通过与四组分辐射计观测计算的表面辐射温度进行验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the collection of detailed snow cover and frozen ground data in alpine regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在高山地区收集详细的雪盖和冻土数据成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Recent technological advancements have enabled the use of state-of-the-art techniques and instruments at snow observation superstations and frozen ground superstations. These advancements include the use of tools like the GammaMONitor for measuring snow water equivalent and the FlowCapt for measuring blowing snow grains, as well as a wireless sensor network for capturing soil temperature and moisture changes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 最近的技术进步使得在雪观测超级站和冻土超级站使用最先进的技术和仪器成为可能。这些进步包括使用GammaMONitor测量雪水当量和FlowCapt测量吹雪颗粒，以及一个无线传感器网络用于捕捉土壤温度和湿度变化。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the expected results not occur when using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation for predicting hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 使用遥感数据结合数据同化预测高山地区水文过程时，预期结果可能不会出现的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Due to the complexities of the earth system, various sources of uncertainties exist in remote sensing data, especially in the alpine region, which need to be validated and calibrated. The cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography inhibit complete and consistent data collection, which hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据中存在各种不确定性，尤其是在高山地区，这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准。寒冷而恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形阻碍了完整和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the reasons that expected outcomes from hydrological models may not align with observed data in alpine regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在高山地区，水文模型的预期结果可能与观测数据不一致的原因有哪些？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data in alpine regions due to difficulties of access and technological barriers hinders alpine hydrological modeling. Additionally, the availability of forcing data is limited, with only a few weather stations functioning in certain areas, and there is a lack of high-quality snow and frozen ground data for model parameterization.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 由于难以进入和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型的建立。此外，强迫数据的可用性有限，某些地区只有少数气象站在运行，并且缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于模型参数化。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the expected accuracy in measuring soil heat conductivity in frozen ground be difficult to achieve?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在测量冻土中的土壤热导率时，预期的准确性可能难以实现的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content, and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations are necessary to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models, but these are challenging to obtain due to the environmental conditions in the alpine regions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量和土壤温度的函数，而这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，现场观测对于评估高山水文模型的参数化是必要的，但由于高山地区的环境条件，这些观测很难获得。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective are the current data collection methods in ensuring the accuracy and completeness of hydrometeorological observations in alpine regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 当前的数据收集方法在确保高山地区水文气象观测的准确性和完整性方面的有效性如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The current data collection methods involve an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network designed to address challenges in alpine regions, such as the cold climate and complex topography. These methods connect automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and superstations for snow and frozen ground observations, which provide high-quality datasets for validating remote sensing data and hydrological models. However, the harsh conditions and technological barriers can still lead to data scarcity and incomplete observations at times.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 当前的数据收集方法涉及一个综合的、分布式的、多尺度的观测网络，旨在应对高山地区的挑战，如寒冷气候和复杂地形。这些方法连接了自动气象站（AMS）和用于雪和冻土观测的超级站，提供高质量的数据集，以验证遥感数据和水文模型。然而，恶劣的条件和技术障碍仍然可能导致数据稀缺和观察不完整。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the primary challenges in developing reliable datasets for hydrological modeling in the Heihe River Basin, and how can they be addressed?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域开发可靠的水文模型数据集面临的主要挑战是什么，以及如何解决这些挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The primary challenges include the cold climate, high altitude, and complex terrain, which complicate data collection and lead to data scarcity. These challenges hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models. To address these issues, a comprehensive observation network has been established, incorporating AMSs and superstations that provide detailed datasets on meteorological, snow, and frozen ground processes, thus improving data availability for model development and validation.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 主要挑战包括寒冷的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素使数据收集变得困难，并导致数据稀缺。这些挑战阻碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。为了解决这些问题，建立了一个综合观测网络，结合了自动气象站（AMS）和超级气象站，提供关于气象、雪和冻土过程的详细数据集，从而改善了模型开发和验证的数据可用性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways can the integration of remote sensing data and ground-based observations enhance the prediction of hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 遥感数据和地面观测的整合可以通过哪些方式增强对高山地区水文过程的预测？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Integrating remote sensing data with ground-based observations can enhance predictions by providing comprehensive datasets that fill observational gaps and improve model accuracy. Remote sensing data, when combined with data assimilation techniques, can validate and calibrate complex earth system models, especially in alpine regions where ground data is scarce. This integration allows for a more accurate understanding of hydrological processes, including snow cover dynamics and freeze-thaw cycles, which are critical for predicting water resources and ecosystem functions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 将遥感数据与地面观测数据相结合，可以通过提供全面的数据集来填补观测空白，提高模型的准确性。遥感数据与数据同化技术相结合，可以验证和校准复杂的地球系统模型，特别是在地面数据稀缺的高山地区。这种整合使我们能够更准确地理解水文过程，包括雪盖动态和冻融循环，这对于预测水资源和生态系统功能至关重要。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data from meteorological sensors in high-altitude alpine regions can be collected consistently despite harsh climate conditions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白在恶劣气候条件下，如何能够持续收集高海拔阿尔卑斯地区气象传感器的数据。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data are monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). The integrated network is designed to overcome challenges like harsh climates by using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments at snow observation superstations and frozen ground superstations.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 无间断的气象和水文数据通过一个连接自动气象站（AMSs）组的观测网络进行监测。该综合网络旨在通过在雪观测超级站和冻土超级站使用先进的技术和仪器，克服恶劣气候带来的挑战。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure how the presence of blowing snow is accounted for in hydrological data collection in alpine regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定在高山地区的水文数据收集中，如何考虑吹雪的存在。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in high-altitude alpine regions, and its occurrence can affect snow cover distribution. The measurement of blowing snow grains is conducted using instruments like FlowCapt, which captures data at various heights to account for redistribution effects.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 吹雪（漂移雪）在高海拔的阿尔卑斯地区常见，其发生会影响雪盖分布。吹雪颗粒的测量使用像FlowCapt这样的仪器，该仪器在不同高度捕获数据，以考虑再分配效应。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please evaluate the potential of integrating remote sensing data with ground-based observations for improving predictive understanding of hydrological processes in alpine regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 评估将遥感数据与地面观测相结合，以提高对高山地区水文过程的预测理解的潜力。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Integrating remote sensing data with ground-based observations can significantly enhance the predictive understanding of hydrological processes by providing comprehensive datasets that capture spatial and temporal variations. Remote sensing data, when combined with ground-based observations such as those from AMSs and superstations, can validate and calibrate models, reduce uncertainties, and improve the accuracy of predictions related to snow cover, soil moisture, and freeze-thaw cycles.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 将遥感数据与地面观测相结合，可以显著增强对水文过程的预测理解，因为这提供了捕捉空间和时间变化的综合数据集。遥感数据与来自自动气象站（AMS）和超级气象站的地面观测相结合，可以验证和校准模型，减少不确定性，并提高与雪盖、土壤湿度和冻融循环相关的预测准确性。
